page.title: 12Government-Bolton by Bowland
page.content: The village and districts round about elect a{Parish Council}which meets every 6 weeks in the school to discuss and make recommendations to the{Ribble {Valley Borough Council}in Clitheroe which is much bigger and is responsible for planning permission, roads,the fire service and has an interest in education. The control over planning permission for housing at local level has meant that new housing is rarely allowed in the area. The{Parochial Church Council}meets regularly to discuss the running and finance of the church. The{Governors of the school}are local people who are responsible for the upkeep of the school buildings and the welfare of the pupils.The school is financed by the{County Council}at Preston and overseen by local district offices in Clitheroe and Accrington.
